description: mounted on tan paper; central female figure with long hair and her drapery flowing behind her head; two putti, each with a bow and arrow, fly in top corners; kissing figures at left; male figure in LRC holding horns (?) with curly hair and beard; putto with sea serpent below female figure
medium: Black and red chalk on laid paper
provenance: Sale, Christie's, London, April 7, 1981, no. 52, for £1,800, to Tan Bunzl; [Yvonne Tan Bunzl, London; 1981-82; sold July 22 for £4,450, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1982-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Triumph of Galatea
